intro: Ceropegia albisepta var. truncata, commonly known as the African violet or string of dolphins, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It features fleshy, trailing stems that produce tubular, pale green to white flowers with a distinctive, fragrant scent. The leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine, woolly coating. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. This plant is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
